Package map

Class Board

java.lang.Object
map.Board
public class Board extends Object
This class store a 2 dimensional Objects array to simulate a map. Also generate a random name for the town and store the height and width.
Author:
Fernando Tarrino del Pozo (FernandoEsra)
See Also:
  • AleatoricName
  • Water

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    The empty constructor are used to create a new board with correct dimensions to display in the Eclipse console (28x50).
    Board(int height, int width)
    This constructor create a empty map with a personalized dimensions and a new aleatoric name.

      public Object[][] board

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      The empty constructor are used to create a new board with correct dimensions to display in the Eclipse console (28x50).

    • Board

      public Board(int height, int width)
      This constructor create a empty map with a personalized dimensions and a new aleatoric name.
      Parameters:
      height - Length for height
      width - Length for width

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Object[][] getBoard()
      Returns:
      The 2 dimensional map object array

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      The name of the town

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns:
      The height lenght of the array.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns:
      The width lenght of the array.

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds(int newX, int newY)
      This method check if the provided coordinates are inside the bounds. This method its really important to prevent OOB crash.
      Parameters:
      newX - Length for board (height). First coordinate.
      newY - Length for board[] [width]. Second coordinate.
      Returns:
      If the coordinates are inside the bounds return true. If the coordinates are OOB, return false.

    • isWater

      public boolean isWater(int searchX, int searchY)
      This method check if one position on the map have a Water object inside.
      Parameters:
      searchX - Length for board (height). First coordinate.
      searchY - Length for board[] [width]. Second coordinate.
      Returns:
      If the coordinates have a water object inside return true. If not, return false.

    • validPosition

      public boolean validPosition(int newX, int newY)
      This method check if one position on the map are inside the limites and has nothing inside.
      Parameters:
      newX - Length for board (height). First coordinate.
      newY - Length for board[] [width]. Second coordinate.
      Returns:
      If the coordinates are inside the bounds and empty (null) return true. If not, return false;

    • totalWater

      public int totalWater()
      This method read all the map and count the water objects inside.
      Returns:
      The amount of water on the map

    • searchXobject

      public int searchXobject(Object toSearch)
      This method search for the height position of one object inside the board.
      Parameters:
      toSearch - Object to search in the board
      Returns:
      If the object exists inside the board, return the heigth index. If not, return -1.

    • searchYobject

      public int searchYobject(Object toSearch)
      This method search for the width position of one object inside the board.
      Parameters:
      toSearch - Object to search in the board
      Returns:
      If the object exists inside the board, return the width index. If not, return -1.

    • getNameOfItem

      public String getNameOfItem(int searchX, int searchY)
      Parameters:
      searchX -
      searchY -
      Returns:

    • getObjectAt

      public Object getObjectAt(int searchX, int searchY)
      This method return one object at (searchX.searchY) position.
      Parameters:
      searchX - Height position to search on the map.
      searchY - Width position to search on the map.
      Returns:
      The object at (searchX.searchY) position. If the possition is empty, return null.

    • eraseObjectAt

      public boolean eraseObjectAt(int searchX, int searchY)
      Set the (searchX.searchY) position to null;
      Parameters:
      searchX - Height position of the map.
      searchY - Width position of the map.
      Returns:
      If something is deleted at the indicated position, return true, if not, return false.

    • addSomething

      public boolean addSomething(Object obj, int mapX, int mapY)
      Add one object to the indicated position. Only work if the possition is valid.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to add.
      mapX - Height position of the map.
      mapY - Width position of the map.
      Returns:
      If something is added at the indicated position, return true, if not, return false.

    • moveSomethingUp

      public boolean moveSomethingUp(Object obj)
      This method run over the array till found the indicated object. Then check if the upper position is valid, if it is, asign the object to that position and erase the object of the original position.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to move up.
      Returns:
      If something is moved return true, if not, return false.

    • moveSomethingDown

      public boolean moveSomethingDown(Object obj)
      This method run over the array till found the indicated object. Then check if the lower position is valid, if it is, asign the object to that position and erase the object of the original position.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to move down.
      Returns:
      If something is moved return true, if not, return false.

    • moveSomethingRight

      public boolean moveSomethingRight(Object obj)
      This method run over the array till found the indicated object. Then check if the right position is valid, if it is, asign the object to that position and erase the object of the original position.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to move to the right.
      Returns:
      If something is moved return true, if not, return false.

    • moveSomethingLeft

      public boolean moveSomethingLeft(Object obj)
      This method run over the array till found the indicated object. Then check if the left position is valid, if it is, asign the object to that position and erase the object of the original position.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to move to the left.
      Returns:
      If something is moved return true, if not, return false.
